alert.note: Alert for Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:57AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central White, southwestern Warrick, central Vanderburgh, central Posey and north central Henderson Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 857 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from New Harmony to Enfield. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Blairsville around 910 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Kasson, Melody Hill, Evansville, Mount Vernon and Newburgh. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 2 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
